snippet: The New Jersey studio and home of Toshiko Takaezu, the Japanese-American ceramist who died last year, is opening to the public.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Don Fletcher was an assistant to ceramist Toshiko Takaezu before she died and has now bought her Quakertown, NJ, studio, which he plans to open to the public; Christie's will offer 166 lots from the book and manuscript collection of Albert H Small; the John Toomey Gallery in Oak Park, Ill, will auction a trove of Stickley furniture from a Colorado vacation retreat built by John L Jerome.
lead_paragraph: The New Jersey studio and home of Toshiko Takaezu, the Japanese-American ceramist who died last year, is opening to the public.

headline.seo: The Ceramist Toshiko Takaezu’s Studio in Quakertown, N.J.
headline.main: Ceramist’s Students Keep Studio and Spirit Alive
